text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The National Bank of Slovakia is finalising a third loan agreement with Japan's Exim bank to support small and medium-sized companies.

- Finance Minister Sergej Kozlik said he was satisfied with the current financing of motorway construction. Kozlik said the government would, by the end of this month, work out a definite strategy for financing motorway construction in 1997 and in the first half of 1998.
- The Bratislava Commodity Exchange plans to start trading currency derivatives in the near future.
- The private sector now accounts for about 95 percent of the retail trade industry.

NARODNA OBRODA - Hungary on Thursday started its second round of arguments before the International Court of Justice in a law suit agaisnt Slovakia over the controversial Gabcikovo dam on the Danube River.

- Opposition Party of the Democratic Left (SDL) deputy, Brigita Schmoegnerova, said a planned joint-venture between Slovak gas distributor SPP and the Russian Gazprom will allow the Russian company to dictate prices to force through its interests in Slovakia.
- Schmoegnerova accused the government of preparing the illegal privatisation of SPP.
- One of the largest Slovak breweries, Topvar, exported 9,930 hectolitres of beer in the first quarter of thie year, up from 6,080 hectolitres in the same period last year.
PRAVDA -GSM operator Globtel, a French-Slovak joint-venture, said it now covered 46 percent of the population and that investment in building the network so far totalled 1.5 billion crowns.

SME - Opposition Christian Democratic Movement (KDH) Deputy Jan Carnogursky said multi-billion-crown deliveries of Russian jet fighters were directed through the private firm Katrim-Stella which has basic capital of 100,000 crowns. He said the company lacked sufficient funds to pay for spare parts so that the Slovak army could not use the jets.
